ThingDef.label: Chespin
ThingDef.description: Such a thick shell of wood covers its head and back that even a direct hit from a truck wouldn’t faze it.\nThe quills on its head are usually soft. When it flexes them, the points become so hard and sharp that they can pierce rock.

ThingDef.label: Quilladin
ThingDef.description: They strengthen their lower bodies by running into one another. They are very kind and won’t start fights.\nIt relies on its sturdy shell to deflect predators’ attacks. It counterattacks with its sharp quills.

ThingDef.label: Chesnaught
ThingDef.description: When it takes a defensive posture with its fists guarding its face, it could withstand a bomb blast.\nIts Tackle is forceful enough to flip a 50-ton tank. It shields its allies from danger with its own body.

ThingDef.label: Fennekin
ThingDef.description: As it walks, it munches on a twig in place of a snack. It intimidates opponents by puffing hot air out of its ears.\nEating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.

ThingDef.label: Braixen
ThingDef.description: When the twig is plucked from its tail, friction sets the twig alight. The flame is used to send signals to its allies.\nIt has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.

ThingDef.label: Delphox
ThingDef.description: Using psychic power, it generates a fiery vortex of 5,400 degrees Fahrenheit, incinerating foes swept into this whirl of flame.\nIt gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.

ThingDef.label: Froakie
ThingDef.description: It protects its skin by covering its body in delicate bubbles. Beneath its happy-go-lucky air, it keeps a watchful eye on its surroundings.\nIt secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.

ThingDef.label: Frogadier
ThingDef.description: Its swiftness is unparalleled. It can scale a tower of more than 2,000 feet in a minute’s time.\nIt can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.

ThingDef.label: Greninja
ThingDef.description: It appears and vanishes with a ninja’s grace. It toys with its enemies using swift movements, while slicing them with throwing stars of sharpest water.\nIt creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.

ThingDef.label: Bunnelby
ThingDef.description: It’s very sensitive to danger. The sound of Corviknight’s flapping will have Bunnelby digging a hole to hide underground in moments.\nIt excels at digging holes. Using its ears, it can dig a nest 33 feet deep in one night.

ThingDef.label: Diggersby
ThingDef.description: The fur on its belly retains heat exceptionally well. People used to make heavy winter clothing from fur shed by this Pokémon.\nWith power equal to an excavator, it can dig through dense bedrock. It’s a huge help during tunnel construction.

ThingDef.label: Fletchling
ThingDef.description: When this Pokémon gets excited, its body temperature increases sharply. If you touch a Fletchling with bare hands, you might get burned.\nIts melodious cries are actually warnings. Fletchling will mercilessly peck at anything that enters its territory.

ThingDef.label: Fletchinder
ThingDef.description: Fletchinder are exceedingly territorial and aggressive. These Pokémon fight among themselves over feeding grounds.\nFletchinder launches embers into the den of its prey. When the prey comes leaping out, Fletchinder’s sharp talons finish it off.

ThingDef.label: Talonflame
ThingDef.description: Talonflame dives toward prey at speeds of up to 310 mph and assaults them with powerful kicks, giving the prey no chance to escape.\nTalonflame mainly preys upon other bird Pokémon. To intimidate opponents, it sends embers spewing from gaps between its feathers.

ThingDef.label: Scatterbug
ThingDef.description: The powder that covers its body regulates its temperature, so it can live in any region or climate.\nWhen under attack from bird Pokémon, it spews a poisonous black powder that causes paralysis on contact.

ThingDef.label: Spewpa
ThingDef.description: The beaks of bird Pokémon can’t begin to scratch its stalwart body. To defend itself, it spews powder.\nIt lives hidden within thicket shadows. When predators attack, it quickly bristles the fur covering its body in an effort to threaten them.

ThingDef.label: Vivillon
ThingDef.description: The patterns on this Pokémon’s wings depend on the climate and topography of its habitat. It scatters colorful scales.\nVivillon with many different patterns are found all over the world. These patterns are affected by the climate of their habitat.

ThingDef.label: Litleo
ThingDef.description: This hot-blooded Pokémon is filled with curiosity. When it gets angry or starts fighting, its short mane gets hot.\nWhen they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.

ThingDef.label: Pyroar
ThingDef.description: The temperature of its breath is over 10,000 degrees Fahrenheit, but Pyroar doesn’t use it on its prey. This Pokémon prefers to eat raw meat.\nThe males are usually lazy, but when attacked by a strong foe, a male will protect its friends with no regard for its own safety.

ThingDef.label: Flabébé
ThingDef.description: Flabébé wears a crown made from pollen it’s collected from its flower. The crown has hidden healing properties.\nIt’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.

ThingDef.label: Floette
ThingDef.description: It gives its own power to flowers, pouring its heart into caring for them. Floette never forgives anyone who messes up a flower bed.\nIt raises flowers and uses them as weapons. The more gorgeous the blossom, the more power it contains.

ThingDef.label: Florges
ThingDef.description: Its life can span several hundred years. It’s said to devote its entire life to protecting gardens.\nIt controls the flowers it grows. The petal blizzards that Florges triggers are overwhelming in their beauty and power.

ThingDef.label: Skiddo
ThingDef.description: If it has sunshine and water, it doesn’t need to eat, because it can generate energy from the leaves on its back.\nThought to be one of the first Pokémon to live in harmony with humans, it has a placid disposition.

ThingDef.label: Gogoat
ThingDef.description: They inhabit mountainous regions. The leader of the herd is decided by a battle of clashing horns.\nIt can tell how its Trainer is feeling by subtle shifts in the grip on its horns. This empathic sense lets them run as if one being.

ThingDef.label: Pancham
ThingDef.description: Wanting to make sure it’s taken seriously, Pancham’s always giving others a glare. But if it’s not focusing, it ends up smiling.\nIt chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master’s actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.

ThingDef.label: Pangoro
ThingDef.description: Using its leaf, Pangoro can predict the moves of its opponents. It strikes with punches that can turn a dump truck into scrap with just one hit.\nThis Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

ThingDef.label: Furfrou
ThingDef.description: Left alone, its fur will grow longer and longer, but it will only allow someone it trusts to cut it.\nThere was an era when aristocrats would compete to see who could trim their Furfrou’s fur into the most exquisite style.

ThingDef.label: Espurr
ThingDef.description: There’s enough psychic power in Espurr to send a wrestler flying, but because this power can’t be controlled, Espurr finds it troublesome.\nThough Espurr’s expression never changes, behind that blank stare is an intense struggle to contain its devastating psychic power.

ThingDef.label: Meowstic
ThingDef.description: The defensive instinct of the males is strong. It’s when they’re protecting themselves or their partners that they unleash their full power.\nRevealing the eyelike patterns on the insides of its ears will unleash its psychic powers. It normally keeps the patterns hidden, however.

ThingDef.label: Honedge
ThingDef.description: The blue eye on the sword’s handguard is the true body of Honedge. With its old cloth, it drains people’s lives away.\nHonedge’s soul once belonged to a person who was killed a long time ago by the sword that makes up Honedge’s body.

ThingDef.label: Doublade
ThingDef.description: The two swords employ a strategy of rapidly alternating between offense and defense to bring down their prey.\nHonedge evolves into twins. The two blades rub together to emit a metallic sound that unnerves opponents.

ThingDef.label: Aegislash
ThingDef.description: Its potent spectral powers allow it to manipulate others. It once used its powers to force people and Pokémon to build a kingdom to its liking.\nIn this defensive stance, Aegislash uses its steel body and a force field of spectral power to reduce the damage of any attack.

ThingDef.label: Spritzee
ThingDef.description: The scent its body gives off enraptures those who smell it. Noble ladies had no shortage of love for Spritzee.\nA scent pouch within this Pokémon’s body allows it to create various scents. A change in its diet will alter the fragrance it produces.

ThingDef.label: Aromatisse
ThingDef.description: The scents Aromatisse can produce range from sweet smells that bolster allies to foul smells that sap an opponent’s will to fight.\nThe scent that constantly emits from its fur is so powerful that this Pokémon’s companions will eventually lose their sense of smell.

ThingDef.label: Swirlix
ThingDef.description: The sweet smell of cotton candy perfumes Swirlix’s fluffy fur. This Pokémon spits out sticky string to tangle up its enemies.\nIt eats its own weight in sugar every day. If it doesn’t get enough sugar, it becomes incredibly grumpy.

ThingDef.label: Slurpuff
ThingDef.description: Slurpuff’s fur contains a lot of air, making it soft to the touch and lighter than it looks.\nBy taking in a person’s scent, it can sniff out their mental and physical condition. It’s hoped that this skill will have many medical applications.

ThingDef.label: Inkay
ThingDef.description: By exposing foes to the blinking of its luminescent spots, Inkay demoralizes them, and then it seizes the chance to flee.\nIt spins while making its luminescent spots flash. These spots allow it to communicate with others by using different patterns of light.

ThingDef.label: Malamar
ThingDef.description: It’s said that Malamar’s hypnotic powers played a role in certain history-changing events.\nGazing at its luminescent spots will quickly induce a hypnotic state, putting the observer under Malamar’s control.

ThingDef.label: Binacle
ThingDef.description: If the two don’t work well together, both their offense and defense fall apart. Without good teamwork, they won’t survive.\nAfter two Binacle find a suitably sized rock, they adhere themselves to it and live together. They cooperate to gather food during high tide.

ThingDef.label: Barbaracle
ThingDef.description: Having an eye on each palm allows it to keep watch in all directions. In a pinch, its limbs start to act on their own to ensure the enemy’s defeat.\nSeven Binacle come together to form one Barbaracle. The Binacle that serves as the head gives orders to those serving as the limbs.

ThingDef.label: Skrelp
ThingDef.description: Skrelp looks like a piece of rotten seaweed, so it can blend in with seaweed drifting on the ocean and avoid being detected by enemies.\nIt drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.

ThingDef.label: Dragalge
ThingDef.description: Dragalge generates dragon energy by sticking the plume on its head out above the ocean’s surface and bathing it in sunlight.\nDragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.

ThingDef.label: Clauncher
ThingDef.description: By detonating gas that accumulates in its right claw, this Pokémon launches water like a bullet. This is how Clauncher defeats its enemies.\nClauncher’s claws can fall off during battle, but they’ll regenerate. The meat inside the claws is popular as a delicacy in Galar.

ThingDef.label: Clawitzer
ThingDef.description: Clawitzer’s right arm is a cannon that launches projectiles made of seawater. Shots from a Clawitzer’s cannon arm can sink a tanker.\nAfter using the feelers on its oversized claw to detect the location of prey, Clawitzer launches a cannonball of water at its target.

ThingDef.label: Helioptile
ThingDef.description: The sun powers this Pokémon’s electricity generation. Interruption of that process stresses Helioptile to the point of weakness.\nWhen spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon’s electric moves.

ThingDef.label: Heliolisk
ThingDef.description: One Heliolisk basking in the sun with its frill outspread is all it would take to produce enough electricity to power a city.\nA now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

ThingDef.label: Tyrunt
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon is selfish and likes to be pampered. It can also inflict grievous wounds on its Trainer just by playing around.\nThis is an ancient Pokémon, revived in modern times. It has a violent disposition, and it’ll tear apart anything it gets between its hefty jaws.

ThingDef.label: Tyrantrum
ThingDef.description: A single bite of Tyrantrum’s massive jaws will demolish a car. This Pokémon was the king of the ancient world.\nThis Pokémon is from about 100,000,000 years ago. It has the presence of a king, vicious but magnificent.

ThingDef.label: Amaura
ThingDef.description: Amaura is an ancient Pokémon that has gone extinct. Specimens of this species can sometimes be found frozen in ice.\nThis Pokémon was successfully restored from a fossil. In the past, it lived with others of its kind in cold lands where there were fewer predators.

ThingDef.label: Aurorus
ThingDef.description: When gripped by rage, Aurorus will emanate freezing air, covering everything around it in ice.\nAurorus was restored from a fossil. It’s said that when this Pokémon howls, auroras appear in the night sky.

ThingDef.label: Sylveon
ThingDef.description: There’s a Galarian fairy tale that describes a beautiful Sylveon vanquishing a dreadful dragon Pokémon.\nBy releasing enmity-erasing waves from its ribbonlike feelers, Sylveon stops any conflict.

ThingDef.label: Hawlucha
ThingDef.description: It always strikes a pose before going for its finishing move. Sometimes opponents take advantage of that time to counterattack.\nIt drives its opponents to exhaustion with its agile maneuvers, then ends the fight with a flashy finishing move.

ThingDef.label: Dedenne
ThingDef.description: Since Dedenne can’t generate much electricity on its own, it steals electricity from outlets or other electric Pokémon.\nA Dedenne’s whiskers pick up electrical waves other Dedenne send out. These Pokémon share locations of food or electricity with one another.

ThingDef.label: Carbink
ThingDef.description: It’s said that somewhere in the world, there’s a mineral vein housing a large pack of slumbering Carbink. It’s also said that this pack has a queen.\nWhen beset by attackers, Carbink wipes them all out by firing high-energy beams from the gems embedded in its body.

ThingDef.label: Goomy
ThingDef.description: Their horns are powerful sensors. As soon as Goomy pick up any sign of enemies, they go into hiding. This is how they’ve survived.\nBecause most of its body is water, it will dry up if the weather becomes too arid. It’s considered the weakest dragon Pokémon.

ThingDef.label: Sliggoo
ThingDef.description: The lump on its back contains its tiny brain. It thinks only of food and escaping its enemies.\nAlthough this Pokémon isn’t very strong, its body is coated in a caustic slime that can melt through anything, so predators steer clear of it.

ThingDef.label: Goodra
ThingDef.description: Its form of offense is forcefully stretching out its horns. The strikes land 100 times harder than any blow from a heavyweight boxer.\nSometimes it misunderstands instructions and appears dazed or bewildered. Many Trainers don’t mind, finding this behavior to be adorable.

ThingDef.label: Klefki
ThingDef.description: Klefki sucks in metal ions with the horn topping its head. It seems this Pokémon loves keys so much that its head needed to look like one, too.\nThis Pokémon is constantly collecting keys. Entrust a Klefki with important keys, and the Pokémon will protect them no matter what.

ThingDef.label: Phantump
ThingDef.description: With a voice like a human child’s, it cries out to lure adults deep into the forest, getting them lost among the trees.\nAfter a lost child perished in the forest, their spirit possessed a tree stump, causing the spirit’s rebirth as this Pokémon.

ThingDef.label: Trevenant
ThingDef.description: Small roots that extend from the tips of this Pokémon’s feet can tie into the trees of the forest and give Trevenant control over them.\nPeople fear it due to a belief that it devours any who try to cut down trees in its forest, but to the Pokémon it shares its woods with, it’s kind.

ThingDef.label: Pumpkaboo
ThingDef.description: The light that streams out from the holes in the pumpkin can hypnotize and control the people and Pokémon that see it.\nSpirits that wander this world are placed into Pumpkaboo’s body. They’re then moved on to the afterlife.

ThingDef.label: Gourgeist
ThingDef.description: In the darkness of a new-moon night, Gourgeist will come knocking. Whoever answers the door will be swept off to the afterlife.\nEerie cries emanate from its body in the dead of night. The sounds are said to be the wails of spirits who are suffering in the afterlife.

ThingDef.label: Bergmite
ThingDef.description: This Pokémon lives in areas of frigid cold. It secures itself to the back of an Avalugg by freezing its feet in place.\nThey chill the air around them to −150 degrees Fahrenheit, freezing the water in the air into ice that they use as armor.

ThingDef.label: Avalugg
ThingDef.description: As Avalugg moves about during the day, the cracks in its body deepen. The Pokémon’s body returns to a pristine state overnight.\nAt high latitudes, this Pokémon can be found with clusters of Bergmite on its back as it swims among the icebergs.

ThingDef.label: Noibat
ThingDef.description: No wavelength of sound is beyond Noibat’s ability to produce. The ultrasonic waves it generates can overcome much larger Pokémon.\nAfter nightfall, they emerge from the caves they nest in during the day. Using their ultrasonic waves, they go on the hunt for ripened fruit.

ThingDef.label: Noivern
ThingDef.description: Flying through the darkness, it weakens enemies with ultrasonic waves that could crush stone. Its fangs finish the fight.\nAggressive and cruel, this Pokémon will ruthlessly torment enemies that are helpless in the dark.

ThingDef.label: Xerneas
ThingDef.description: When the horns on its head shine in seven colors, it is said to be sharing everlasting life.\nLegends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.

ThingDef.label: Yveltal
ThingDef.description: When its life comes to an end, it absorbs the life energy of every living thing and turns into a cocoon once more.\nWhen this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

ThingDef.label: Zygarde
ThingDef.description: Some say it can change to an even more powerful form when battling those who threaten the ecosystem.\nThis is Zygarde’s form when about half of its pieces have been assembled. It plays the role of monitoring the ecosystem.

ThingDef.label: Diancie
ThingDef.description: It can instantly create many diamonds by compressing the carbon in the air between its hands.\nA sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.

ThingDef.label: Hoopa
ThingDef.description: It is said to be able to seize anything it desires with its six rings and six huge arms. With its power sealed, it is transformed into a much smaller form.\nIn its true form, it possesses a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.

ThingDef.label: Volcanion
ThingDef.description: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.\nIt lets out billows of steam and disappears into the dense fog. It’s said to live in mountains where humans do not tread.
